sub_title: Product Marketing Team Lead, Senior C++ Software Developer
summary:
As a C and C++ software developer, Anastasia Kazakova created real-time *nix-based systems and pushed them to production for 8 years. She worked as an intern in Microsoft Research, Networking department, and launched the first 4G network in Russia being a part of the Yota operator team. She has a passion for networking algorithms and embedded programming and believes in good tooling. She is now Product Marketing Team Lead for C++ and .NET tools at JetBrains.
https://github.com/anastasiak2512/speaking

projects.title: Yota PCRF
projects.description:
Yota PCRF (Policy and Charging Rules Function) is an advanced policy management solution enabling the operator to dynamically control network elements and apply real-time policies based on service, subscriber and usage context. 

Yota PCRF allows the operator to succeed at a turbulent IP market by quickly responding to changing consumer data habits and outpacing competitors in introducing new services. It facilitates making flexible policy decisions based on a wide variety of parameters including the following:
    subscriber profile and services,
    application, protocol (Skype, P2P), content type (Video, MP3),
    subscriber device (Mobile, iPad, TV, PC),
    subscriber location (home, roaming, specific cell),
    accumulated usage (per month, week, day, hour),
    cell congestion.

Script-based logic of Yota PCRF allows taking into account all available parameters with any combinations of the parameters and conditions, thus enabling CSPs to launch new services without a need for any software development with shortest time to market.

Yota PCRF optimizes the network utilization and protects the operator’s key revenue-generating services from being cannibalized by growing data consumption. It can provide subscribers with increased bandwidth when extra network capacity is available, and reduce bandwidth when network is congested to prevent overload. It can also balance QoS based on service and subscriber priority.

Yota PCRF enables the operator to monetize Over-the-Top services, like Internet video, which generate a heavy load on the mobile network, but do not directly produce any revenue for an operator. The operator can offer a bundled QoS option for partner’s streaming Internet video service and optimize the delivery based on the service, type of device and the network subscriber is using. Thus operators can generate additional income from OTT services while improving user experience for subscribers.

profile_positions.description:
Working with the following products: .NET Tools including ReSharper, Rider, dotTrace, dotCover, dotMemory, dotPeek, RiderFlow.

Responsibilities: 
- Building marketing strategy for the products in the areas of responsibility.
- Building and leading a distributed team. 
- Working closely with developers, QA engineers, product managers, and product team leads to build a product development strategy. 
- Supervising all the marketing materials production. 
- Conducting product usability testing and suggesting product improvements.
- Managing participation in marketing events such as conferences, exhibitions, webinars etc. 
- Managing work with influencers on the social media including but not limited to sponsoring them, ordering posts in media, engaging them in online and offline events. 
- Organising online and offline events to advertise the products and educate company products’ users. 
- Performing co-marketing activities with larger customers.

profile_positions.description:
PCRF project
PCRF is a centralized policy decision point in the network of a service provider. It enables flexible configuration and control of QoS parameters of the provided services, optimizes network resources usage and provides information for charging the services according to the provided level of QoS.
Yota PCRF allows making policy decisions based on the following parameters: subscriber device (Mobile, iPad, TV, PC), subscriber application and protocol (Skype, P2P), content type (Video, MP3), time and date,accumulated usage (per day, week, month),network parameters (e.g. congestion level), subscriber location (home, roaming, specific cell), subscriber profile and enabled services, etc. Managing network capacity through policy, quality of service, congestion control, the peak time traffic costs can be lowered by 10-20% across the network. Free version (http://freepcrf.com)

Responsibilities:
- Full cycle of designing, developing, and performance testing of the PCRF application.
- Performance scenarios creation/running/optimization, implementation of the performance auto-testing subsystem.
- Routing agent architecture design and implementation.
profile_positions.title: Senior developer

profile_positions.description:
Home networking area.
Creating system for automatic congestions problem resolving in Home Networks. The competition for the network resources is resolved with the help of the home router. The system takes care of measurements tools, rate controller and traffic management policies.

Mentors: Christos Gkantsidis, Thomas Karagiannis (Microsoft Research Cambridge)
Supervisor: Andrew Terekhov (SPbSU).
